trans-unit.source: Configuring Stateful Reliable Services
trans-unit.target: Configuring Stateful Reliable Services

trans-unit.source: Learn about configuring stateful Reliable Services in Service Fabric.
trans-unit.target: Learn about configuring stateful Reliable Services in Service Fabric.

trans-unit.source: Stateful Reliable Service's default configuration can be modified by changing the "settings.xml" file generated in the Visual Studio package root under the "Config" folder for each service in the application.
trans-unit.target: Stateful Reliable Service's default configuration can be modified by changing the "settings.xml" file generated in the Visual Studio package root under the "Config" folder for each service in the application.

trans-unit.source: The Service Fabric runtime looks for pre-defined section names in the "settings.xml" file and consumes the configuration values while creating the underlying runtime components.
trans-unit.target: The Service Fabric runtime looks for pre-defined section names in the "settings.xml" file and consumes the configuration values while creating the underlying runtime components.

trans-unit.source: Do NOT delete/modify the section names of the following configurations in the "settings.xml" file that is generated in the Visual Studio Solution.
trans-unit.target: Do NOT delete/modify the section names of the following configurations in the "settings.xml" file that is generated in the Visual Studio Solution.

trans-unit.source: Replicator Security Configurations are used to secure the communication channel that is used during replication.
trans-unit.target: Replicator Security Configurations are used to secure the communication channel that is used during replication.

trans-unit.source: This means services will not be able to see each other's replication traffic, ensuring the data that is made highly available is also secure.
trans-unit.target: This means services will not be able to see each other's replication traffic, ensuring the data that is made highly available is also secure.

trans-unit.source: By default, an empty security configuration section does not enable replication security.
trans-unit.target: By default, an empty security configuration section does not enable replication security.

trans-unit.source: ReplicatorSecurityConfig
trans-unit.target: ReplicatorSecurityConfig

trans-unit.source: Refer to <linkText>Replication Security</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Refer to <linkText>Replication Security</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Replicator Configurations are used to configure the replicator that is responsible for making the stateful Reliable Service's state highly reliable by replicating and persisting the state locally.
trans-unit.target: Replicator Configurations are used to configure the replicator that is responsible for making the stateful Reliable Service's state highly reliable by replicating and persisting the state locally.

trans-unit.source: The default configuration is generated by the Visual Studio template and should suffice.
trans-unit.target: The default configuration is generated by the Visual Studio template and should suffice.

trans-unit.source: This section talks about additional configurations that are available to tune the replicator.
trans-unit.target: This section talks about additional configurations that are available to tune the replicator.

trans-unit.source: ReplicatorConfig
trans-unit.target: ReplicatorConfig

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Unit
trans-unit.target: Unit

trans-unit.source: Default Value
trans-unit.target: Default Value

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: BatchAcknowledgementInterval
trans-unit.target: BatchAcknowledgementInterval

trans-unit.source: Seconds
trans-unit.target: Seconds

trans-unit.source: Time period for which the replicator at the secondary waits after receiving an operation before sending back an acknowledgement to the primary.
trans-unit.target: Time period for which the replicator at the secondary waits after receiving an operation before sending back an acknowledgement to the primary.

trans-unit.source: Any other acknowledgements to be sent for operations processed within this interval are sent as one response.
trans-unit.target: Any other acknowledgements to be sent for operations processed within this interval are sent as one response.

trans-unit.source: ReplicatorEndpoint
trans-unit.target: ReplicatorEndpoint

trans-unit.source: N/A
trans-unit.target: N/A

trans-unit.source: N/A - RequiredParameter
trans-unit.target: N/A - RequiredParameter

trans-unit.source: IP address and port that the primary/secondary replicator will use to communicate with other replicators in the replica set.
trans-unit.target: IP address and port that the primary/secondary replicator will use to communicate with other replicators in the replica set.

trans-unit.source: This should reference a TCP Resource Endpoint in the service manifest.
trans-unit.target: This should reference a TCP Resource Endpoint in the service manifest.

trans-unit.source: Refer to <linkText>Service Manifest Resources</linkText><title></title> to read more about defining endpoint resources in service manifest.
trans-unit.target: Refer to <linkText>Service Manifest Resources</linkText><title></title> to read more about defining endpoint resources in service manifest.

trans-unit.source: RetryInterval
trans-unit.target: RetryInterval

trans-unit.source: Seconds
trans-unit.target: Seconds

trans-unit.source: Time period after which the replicator re-transmits a message if it does not receive an acknowledgement for an operation.
trans-unit.target: Time period after which the replicator re-transmits a message if it does not receive an acknowledgement for an operation.

trans-unit.source: MaxReplicationMessageSize
trans-unit.target: MaxReplicationMessageSize

trans-unit.source: Bytes
trans-unit.target: Bytes

trans-unit.source: 50MB
trans-unit.target: 50MB

trans-unit.source: Maximum size of replication data that can be transmitted in a single message.
trans-unit.target: Maximum size of replication data that can be transmitted in a single message.

trans-unit.source: MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueSize
trans-unit.target: MaxPrimaryReplicationQueueSize

trans-unit.source: Number of operations
trans-unit.target: Number of operations

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of operations in the primary queue.
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of operations in the primary queue.

trans-unit.source: An Operation is freed up after the primary replicator receives an acknowledgement from all the secondary replicators.This value must be greater than 64 and a power of 2.
trans-unit.target: An Operation is freed up after the primary replicator receives an acknowledgement from all the secondary replicators.This value must be greater than 64 and a power of 2.

trans-unit.source: MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueSize
trans-unit.target: MaxSecondaryReplicationQueueSize

trans-unit.source: Number of operations
trans-unit.target: Number of operations

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of operations in the secondary queue.
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of operations in the secondary queue.

trans-unit.source: An Operation is freed up after making its state highly available through persistence.
trans-unit.target: An Operation is freed up after making its state highly available through persistence.

trans-unit.source: This value must be greater than 64 and a power of 2.
trans-unit.target: This value must be greater than 64 and a power of 2.

trans-unit.source: MaxStreamSizeInMB
trans-unit.target: MaxStreamSizeInMB

trans-unit.source: MB
trans-unit.target: MB

trans-unit.source: Amount of log file space that is reserved.
trans-unit.target: Amount of log file space that is reserved.

trans-unit.source: The size in bytes must be larger than 16 times the MaxRecordSize in bytes.
trans-unit.target: The size in bytes must be larger than 16 times the MaxRecordSize in bytes.

trans-unit.source: MaxRecordSizeInKB
trans-unit.target: MaxRecordSizeInKB

trans-unit.source: KB
trans-unit.target: KB

trans-unit.source: Largest record size which the replicator may write in the log.
trans-unit.target: Largest record size which the replicator may write in the log.

trans-unit.source: This value must be a multiple of 4 and greater than 16.
trans-unit.target: This value must be a multiple of 4 and greater than 16.

trans-unit.source: OptimizeForLocalSSD
trans-unit.target: OptimizeForLocalSSD

trans-unit.source: boolean
trans-unit.target: boolean

trans-unit.source: false
trans-unit.target: false

trans-unit.source: When true the log is configured so state information is written directly to the replica's dedicated log file.
trans-unit.target: When true the log is configured so state information is written directly to the replica's dedicated log file.

trans-unit.source: This provides best performance when log files are on solid state disk media or when the VM disk IO rate is highly throttled.
trans-unit.target: This provides best performance when log files are on solid state disk media or when the VM disk IO rate is highly throttled.

trans-unit.source: When false the state information is staged in the shared log file first and then destaged to the dedicated log file.
trans-unit.target: When false the state information is staged in the shared log file first and then destaged to the dedicated log file.

trans-unit.source: OptimizeLogForLowerDiskUsage
trans-unit.target: OptimizeLogForLowerDiskUsage

trans-unit.source: boolean
trans-unit.target: boolean

trans-unit.source: false
trans-unit.target: false

trans-unit.source: When true the log is configured to so that the replica's dedicated log file is created using an NTFS sparse file.
trans-unit.target: When true the log is configured to so that the replica's dedicated log file is created using an NTFS sparse file.

trans-unit.source: This lowers the actual disk space usage for the file.
trans-unit.target: This lowers the actual disk space usage for the file.

trans-unit.source: When false the file is created with fixed allocations which provide the best write performance.
trans-unit.target: When false the file is created with fixed allocations which provide the best write performance.

trans-unit.source: SharedLogId
trans-unit.target: SharedLogId

trans-unit.source: guid
trans-unit.target: guid

trans-unit.source: Specifies a unique guid to use for identifying the shared log file used with this replica.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a unique guid to use for identifying the shared log file used with this replica.

trans-unit.source: Typically services should not use this setting however if SharedLogId is specified then SharedLogPath must also be specified.
trans-unit.target: Typically services should not use this setting however if SharedLogId is specified then SharedLogPath must also be specified.

trans-unit.source: SharedLogPath
trans-unit.target: SharedLogPath

trans-unit.source: Fully qualified pathname
trans-unit.target: Fully qualified pathname

trans-unit.source: Specifies the fully qualified path where the shared log file for this replica will be created.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the fully qualified path where the shared log file for this replica will be created.

trans-unit.source: Typically services should not use this setting however if SharedLogPath is specified then SharedLogId must also be specified.
trans-unit.target: Typically services should not use this setting however if SharedLogPath is specified then SharedLogId must also be specified.

trans-unit.source: BatchAcknowledgementInterval controls replication latency.
trans-unit.target: BatchAcknowledgementInterval controls replication latency.

trans-unit.source: A value of '0' results in the lowest possible latency, at the cost of throughput (as more acknowledgement messages must be sent and processed, each containing fewer acknowledgements).
trans-unit.target: A value of '0' results in the lowest possible latency, at the cost of throughput (as more acknowledgement messages must be sent and processed, each containing fewer acknowledgements).

trans-unit.source: The larger the value for BatchAcknowledgementInterval, the higher the overall replication throughput, at the cost of higher operation latency.
trans-unit.target: The larger the value for BatchAcknowledgementInterval, the higher the overall replication throughput, at the cost of higher operation latency.

trans-unit.source: This directly translates to the latency of transaction commits.
trans-unit.target: This directly translates to the latency of transaction commits.

trans-unit.source: The value for MaxStreamSizeInMB determines the amount of disk space that the replicator can use to store state information in the replica's dedicated log file.
trans-unit.target: The value for MaxStreamSizeInMB determines the amount of disk space that the replicator can use to store state information in the replica's dedicated log file.

trans-unit.source: Since the stored information state is used to allow another replica to match the state of a primary replica, it is generally better to have a larger log file as this will reduce the amount of time it takes for the other replica to match the state of the primary.
trans-unit.target: Since the stored information state is used to allow another replica to match the state of a primary replica, it is generally better to have a larger log file as this will reduce the amount of time it takes for the other replica to match the state of the primary.

trans-unit.source: However larger log files may use more disk space and thus reduce the number of replicas that can be hosted on a particular node.
trans-unit.target: However larger log files may use more disk space and thus reduce the number of replicas that can be hosted on a particular node.

trans-unit.source: The OptimizeForLowerDiskUsage setting allows log file space to be "over-provisioned" so that active replicas can store more state information in their log files while inactive replicas would use less disk space.
trans-unit.target: The OptimizeForLowerDiskUsage setting allows log file space to be "over-provisioned" so that active replicas can store more state information in their log files while inactive replicas would use less disk space.

trans-unit.source: Although this allows more replicas to be hosted on a node than would otherwise happen because of a lack of disk space, by setting OptimizeForLowerDiskUsage to false the state information is written to the log files more quickly.
trans-unit.target: Although this allows more replicas to be hosted on a node than would otherwise happen because of a lack of disk space, by setting OptimizeForLowerDiskUsage to false the state information is written to the log files more quickly.

trans-unit.source: The OptimizeForLocalSSD setting is used to disable writing state information to the shared log file first before destaging to the dedicated log file.
trans-unit.target: The OptimizeForLocalSSD setting is used to disable writing state information to the shared log file first before destaging to the dedicated log file.

trans-unit.source: It should typically be set when the local disk storage for the dedicated log file is solid state media as minimizing disk head movement is not an issue.
trans-unit.target: It should typically be set when the local disk storage for the dedicated log file is solid state media as minimizing disk head movement is not an issue.

trans-unit.source: It may also be used when the VM is performing a lot of local disk IO and local disk IO rates are significantly throttled by the VM host.
trans-unit.target: It may also be used when the VM is performing a lot of local disk IO and local disk IO rates are significantly throttled by the VM host.

trans-unit.source: The MaxRecordSizeInKB defines the maximum size of a record that can be written by the replicator into the log file.
trans-unit.target: The MaxRecordSizeInKB defines the maximum size of a record that can be written by the replicator into the log file.

trans-unit.source: In most all cases the default 1024KB record size is optimal however if the service is causing larger data items to be part of the state information then this value might need to be increased.
trans-unit.target: In most all cases the default 1024KB record size is optimal however if the service is causing larger data items to be part of the state information then this value might need to be increased.

trans-unit.source: There is little benefit in making the MaxRecordSizeInKB smaller than 1024 as smaller records only use the space needed for the smaller record.
trans-unit.target: There is little benefit in making the MaxRecordSizeInKB smaller than 1024 as smaller records only use the space needed for the smaller record.

trans-unit.source: It is expected that it would need to be changed in only rare cases.
trans-unit.target: It is expected that it would need to be changed in only rare cases.

trans-unit.source: The SharedLogId and SharedLogPath settings are always used together and allow a service to use a separate shared log from the default shared log for the node.
trans-unit.target: The SharedLogId and SharedLogPath settings are always used together and allow a service to use a separate shared log from the default shared log for the node.

trans-unit.source: For best efficiency, as many services as possible should specify the same shared log.
trans-unit.target: For best efficiency, as many services as possible should specify the same shared log.

trans-unit.source: Shared log files should be placed on disks that are used solely for the shared log file so that head movement contention is reduced.
trans-unit.target: Shared log files should be placed on disks that are used solely for the shared log file so that head movement contention is reduced.

trans-unit.source: It is expected that it would need to be changed in only rare cases.
trans-unit.target: It is expected that it would need to be changed in only rare cases.
